page.title: 17SWINLEY PARK, BRACKNELL.
page.content:
The{Rides}in the Park were used by huntsmen. These are narrow and the trees above overlap, unlike the {fire-breaks}which are much wider. Some of the main{tracks}in the Park were built by the Army during the Second World War. Ammunition was moved to and from secret brick and concrete bunkers. The remains of these ammunition "dumps" are in evidence today.
{ Animals}such as deer, foxes, squirrels and rabbits are often seen by people walking in this part of the forest.
{Fences}and fencing stakes are made from softwood like Scots Pine, brought in from other parts of the Crown Estate as the trees in Swinley Park are not yet mature enough for use.
